episode.title: Australian Battery Scam
episode.author: Daring Fireball / John Gruber
episode.description: Special guest Jason Snell returns for the penultimate episode of 2017. Topics include the iPhone battery performance-throttling saga, Google Maps vs. Apple Maps, new versions of iOS running slow on older iPhones, the new iMac Pro, iOS file management, and more.
episode.showNotes:
Special guest Jason Snell returns for the penultimate episode of 2017. Topics include the iPhone battery performance-throttling saga, Google Maps vs. Apple Maps, new versions of iOS running slow on older iPhones, the new iMac Pro, iOS file management, and more.

Sponsored by:

  • Fracture: Photos printed in vivid color directly on glass. Get 15% off your first order with code talk15.
  • Squarespace: Make your next move. Use code talkshow for 10% off your first order.
  • Eero: Finally, Wi-Fi that works. Use code thetalkshow for free overnight shipping in the U.S. and Canada.

Links:

  • Apple: “A Message to Our Customers About iPhone Batteries and Performance”.
  • Apple KnowledgeBase: “iPhone Battery and Performance”.
  • Jason’s interview with Greg Joswiak back in 2007 on the original iPhone’s battery.
  • Jason on transferring files from an SD card to iOS devices.
  • Twitter thread on iOS devices and USB storage.
  • Reddit thread on Android phones, including reports from people with older devices with failing batteries.
  • Jason and Myke Hurley’s Upgrade Holiday Special.
  • Apollo 13.
  • Justin O’Beirne: “Google’s Maps Moat”.
  • iZotope RX 6: de-noising, de-echoing software.
  • Jason’s new iMac Pro.
  • The Apple IIc from 1984.
  • Font/DA Mover — this is how we installed fonts back in the day.
  • SteerMouse — third-party mouse driver for MacOS that lets you set incredibly fast mouse speeds. Good for RSI sufferers.
  • Samsung’s T5 SSD external USB 3.1 storage drives.

This episode of The Talk Show was edited by Caleb Sexton.
